question: [File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Serialization: Packed Encoding] Can maliciously crafted protobuf messages with incorrect wire types for fields bypass type validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Serialization: Unknown Fields] Does the deserializer silently ignore unknown fields, potentially allowing version confusion attacks across different protocol versions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Serialization: Message Size] Is there a maximum message size enforced for TransactionsOutput to prevent gigantic messages causing memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Enum: StatusType] [Invalid Enum Value] Can StatusType be set to an i32 value outside the defined range (0-2), causing match statement panics or undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Enum: StatusType.as_str_name()] [Unhandled Enum] Does as_str_name() handle invalid enum values gracefully, or could it cause panics when serializing malformed messages? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Enum: StatusType.from_str_name()] [String Injection] Can from_str_name() be exploited with crafted strings to cause parsing errors or bypass validation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Concurrency: Multiple Readers] If multiple threads/tasks are consuming the same stream, can race conditions cause transactions to be processed out of order? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Concurrency: Version Counter] Is there a shared version counter that could race across multiple concurrent streams, causing version inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Concurrency: Stream State] If stream state (INIT/BATCH_END) is shared across threads, can TOCTOU (time-of-check-time-of-use) bugs occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Replay Attack: Version Reuse] Can a malicious node serve the same version range multiple times across different streams, causing transaction replay? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Replay Attack: Historical Transactions] Can old transactions from pruned history be replayed with fake version numbers to bypass sequence number checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Ordering: Transaction Dependencies] If transactions have dependencies (e.g., account sequence numbers), can out-of-order delivery cause execution failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Integrity: Missing Transaction Hashes] Are transaction hashes included and verified to ensure data hasn't been tampered with during transmission? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Integrity: State Root Verification] Does the protocol include state root hashes to verify the correctness of the transaction batch against the Merkle tree? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Integrity: Transaction Signatures] Are transaction signatures validated before adding to the ledger, or are they trusted from the streaming source? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Resource: Memory Leak] If streams are abandoned without proper cleanup (no BATCH_END sent), can buffered transactions accumulate causing memory leaks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Resource: Connection Exhaustion] Can an attacker open many long-lived streams to exhaust file descriptors or connection limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Resource: CPU Exhaustion] Can processing of malformed or complex Transaction messages cause excessive CPU usage during deserialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Edge Case: u64::MAX Version] What happens when start_version or end_version reaches u64::MAX - can the ledger continue operating? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Edge Case: Single Transaction Batch] If a batch contains exactly one transaction (start_version == end_version), are off-by-one errors possible? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Edge Case: Zero-Length Stream] If GetTransactionsFromNodeRequest has starting_version set but transactions_count = 0, what is returned? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Edge Case: Backward Version Range] If starting_version > ledger's current version, does the stream wait for future transactions or immediately error? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Compatibility: Version Mismatch] If client and server have different versions of the protobuf schema (v1 vs v2), can this cause parsing errors or security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Compatibility: Field Addition] If new required fields are added in future versions, will older clients fail gracefully or crash? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Compatibility: Enum Expansion] If new StatusType values are added, will older code handle them as Unspecified or crash? (Low)
